bibl.title: Letter from [Frank F. Law] to Raymond O. Dart, March 19, 1948

div1.p: [Law] offers to send Cornwell's painting, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” to the Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from [Frank F. Law] to Raymond O. Dart, March 19, 1948
div1.opener:
DR HENCH
WYETH INCORPORATED
March 19, 1948
Colonel Raymond O. Dart
Army Institute of Pathology
Washington, D. C.
Dear Colonel Dart:
div1.p:
Our good friend Dr. Hench has advised me that the
Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine will
be held in Washington the week of May 10 to 18 and that
you will have a Walter Reed celebration on May 12.

He suggested that we may wish to offer you the use
of our original painting, “Conquerors of Yellow Fever”
for display at the Walter Reed exhibit. This painting
is one of our Pioneers of American Medicine series.

Dr. Hench was advisor to the artist, Dean Cornwell,
and his great knowledge of yellow fever and Walter Reed's
work was most helpful in achieving a painting that repre-
sents true historical facts on Reed's contribution to
the conquering of this dread disease.

If you would like to use the painting at that time
we shall be happy to forward it without charge. Please
direct your communications in reference to this to our
Advertising Manager, Mr. Richard Roley, who will arrange
the details.
